title: Slow Cooker German-Style Pork Roast with Sauerkraut and Potatoes Recipe
description: This crockpot pork roast with sauerkraut, potatoes, garlic, and caraway seeds simmers in the slow cooker for a delectable, satisfying Irish dinner.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Slow Cooker German-Style Pork Roast with Sauerkraut and Potatoes 4.4 (130) 102 Reviews 7 Photos This crockpot pork roast with sauerkraut and caraway seeds becomes tender and delicious when cooked slowly. This gets raves from my German father. My Irish husband loves it, too! Submitted by Dianemwj Updated on December 19, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 7 7 7 7 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 8 hrs Total Time: 8 hrs 20 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 6 white potatoes, peeled and quartered 1 tablespoon minced garlic salt and pepper to taste 1 (3 pound) boneless pork loin roast 1 (32 ounce) jar sauerkraut with liquid 2 teaspoons caraway seeds Directions Place potatoes, garlic, salt, and pepper in a slow cooker; stir to coat. Season pork roast with salt and pepper; lay over potatoes. Pour sauerkraut over roast and sprinkle with caraway seeds. Cook on Low for 8 to 10 hours. I Made It Print 231 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 386 Calories 15g Fat 31g Carbs 31g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 386 % Daily Value * Total Fat 15g 19% Saturated Fat 6g 28% Cholesterol 83mg 28% Sodium 810mg 35% Total Carbohydrate 31g 11% Dietary Fiber 7g 25% Total Sugars 4g Protein 31g 63% Vitamin C 49mg 54% Calcium 73mg 6% Iron 4mg 20% Potassium 1264mg 27% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Slow Cooker German-Style Pork Roast with Sauerkraut and Potatoes 01 of 07 Photo by  Danielle Holt 02 of 07 Photo by  CoolGlass6653 01/02/2024 Been making this recipe from this site for New Year’s Day for years. Had to hop on here and review it. It’s perfect and delicious every year! And serve with a side of stovetop cinnamon apples and warm rolls with butter. 03 of 07 Photo by  Eugene Ehrenkaufer 11/16/2018 04 of 07 Photo by  Muriel 08/23/2018 I've been making this for years because it's so easy and so good! My husband prefers using sauerkraut that comes in a jar because the flavor just seems to be better. Depending on how big your slow cooker is...and the amount of pork you're cooking...you can use up to two jars. (Use the large jars that hold the same amount of sauerkraut that the large cans do). If you want a milder sauerkraut flavor, however, cut your sauerkraut liquid in half and add water for that other half, instead. Or just use the sauerkraut and water...no sauerkraut liquid at all. Believe me, the flavor will still be there. Make sure your pork is almost completely covered by the liquid you've put in. This way it will be moist and just fall apart when it's done! I love the carraway seeds but if you don't have any, don't worry...salt and pepper works just fine! (Add an onion or a bit of garlic or even Pickling Spice if you're in the mood for them but they're not really necessary). You can also add a level teaspoon or two of regular sugar (or a half-packet to one packet of Sweet N Low) if you find the liquid to be a bit too tart or bitter for your tastebuds. Then add your potatoes when the pork seems to be about half done. I like to wait until the meat is falling off the bone before telling my husband to "come and get it!" :) 05 of 07 Photo by  Edward W Cable 12/31/2017 06 of 07 Photo by  Scoot0023 03/05/2016 This is without a doubt a great and easy dish to make. I'm a working man and cooking time is limited when I get home. So I prepare it the night before, leave it in the refrigerator, then add it to and start the Crockpot when i leave in the morning. I actually crave this and cook it every month to month1/2. 07 of 07 Photo by  Danielle Holt 02/22/2016 1 You’ll Also Love Pork Roast and Sauerkraut 16 Ratings Slow Cooker Cider Pork Roast 69 Ratings Slow Cooker Ham and Beans 163 Ratings Sausage and Sauerkraut 291 Ratings Slow Cooker Machaca 53 Ratings German Pork Chops and Sauerkraut 239 Ratings One-Skillet Corned Beef Hash 104 Ratings Bone-In Ham Cooked in Beer 131 Ratings Homestyle Kalua Pork with Cabbage in a Slow Cooker 152 Ratings Cheddar Bratzenkraut 2 Ratings Tequila Lime Pork Tenderloin 68 Ratings Cranberry Pot Roast 93 Ratings Greek Pork Tenderloin 457 Ratings Slow Cooker Pork, Sauerkraut, and Beer 17 Ratings Krautburger 77 Ratings Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie 111 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Dianemwj
instructions: Place potatoes, garlic, salt, and pepper in a slow cooker; stir to coat. Season pork roast with salt and pepper; lay over potatoes. Pour sauerkraut over roast and sprinkle with caraway seeds.;Cook on Low for 8 to 10 hours.
